result.execSummary:
The defendant Cj A. Greyhair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.
Obtain and maintain employment approved by the agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Contact with K.F, the victim, to be determined by his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Participate in Domestic Violence Court, if agent determines it appropriate.

defendant.name: Greyhair, Cj A.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Osborne appeared by telephone. Parties have the revocation summary.  State recommended:  90 days jail.  Attorney Osborne stipulates to the same.  Credit for 116 days.  Court ordered:  90 days jail. Time served.
from Attorney Osborne
Atty Osborne's request made on 1/12/17 to appear by phone for SEHR on 1/12/17 at 1:30 approved.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 12, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
from DOC
DV Court - Doing well.
for Domestic Violence Court Jail Sanction
DV court.  Missed B.G.'s group.  3 day sanction.  Start within 1 week from this Friday by 6:30 pm.  Go to B.G.'s class this week on Wednesday.  Talk with agent to set up report date.
Allowing Release of Balance of Cash Bond to Poster.
from Attorney Garnder
DV court.  He's working at the casino.  Over 40 hours.  Doing good with B.G. and H.

Defendant appears with counsel Robert Gardner.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Case was Judge Goodman's but has been returned to Judge Becker as the responsible court official.   Defendant is requesting the remainder of cash bond be returned to the poster.  Restitution due in 13CF60 and clerk is requesting the bond be applied to 13CF60.  Judge Becker notes that case 13CF60 has not been returned to her only 15CM220.  That case is still with Judge Goodman.  Per DA Fox there is no restitution due in 13CF60.  Clerk clarified that he does owe restitution to two creditors in that case.  Black River Memorial Hospital and Gundersen Health Services were both set at zero for restitution.  There is still restitution owed to BRF EMS and Tri-State Ambulance according to clerk's records.  DA Fox looks up statute regarding cash deposit and how it should be applied; cannot find any authority for it to be applied to a case not attached to the cash bond.  Court orders the remaining cash bond be returned to poster.  Defendant still has obligation to pay all court ordered financial obligations on 13CF60.  Attorney Gardner will do an Order for payment of the remaining cash bond on file.  Poster was present in the courtroom and clerk verified poster's address and it is correct.

DV court.  Problem over the weekend.  What could you do differently?  Did good with community service.  Has work orientation on 8/15.  Continue with CS this week yet.  Keep agent posted on when he starts job.
DV court.  Will hear from possible job tomorrow.  Doing community service at the shelter.    Turn hours into probation agent.  Keep agent posted on job situation.
Per Deb, set MH on Atty Gardner's Motion filed 6/30/16; contacted Atty Rbt Gardner to schedule date.
Motion hearing on August 12, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

DV Court - Defendant states he has employment hopefully lined up.  He's doing community service with HCN.  Judge instructs him to check in with Animal Shelter today for community service hours.  They are in dire need.  Once employed he is to let his agent know and won't have to do C.S.
for Return of Balance of Cash Bail.
from Attorney Gardner

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: DV court.  First time.  Judge explained expectations to the defendant.
DNA submission form.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.   Sentencing in 13CF60, Count 1.  Plea/sentencing on Count 1,  Domestic DC in 15CM220.  Dismiss but read in remaining counts in that case.  Defendant plead guilty to count 1 in 15CM220.    Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of  Domestic DC contrary to 947.01(1)  Count 2 DRI.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.  10 days conditional jail.  Find time served.  Contact with KF the victim, to be determined by his agent.      Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.     The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA.  Participate with DV court if agent recommends.  CC.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  Concurrent with probation now serving.  10 days conditional jail.  Find time served.  Contact with KF the victim, to be determined by his agent.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants.  Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA and recommendations.  Obtain and maintain employment approved by his agent.  Participate with DV court if agent recommends.    CC.  

2 years probation in 13CF60.  Concurrent with probation now serving.   Contact with KF the victim, to be determined by his agent.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent. Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:K. F. residence; employment.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
Pre-trial conference at 03-09-2016 10:00 am

Defendant appears in custody with counsel Robert Gardner.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defense admits to receipt of complaint and waives the reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Court reads charges and potential penalites.  Court ordered the parties may pretrial and then his J.A. will set a status conference at a later date.  13F60 will track with this case as they will be resolved at the same time.  Attorney Gardner addressed bond requested a reduction in bond to $500 cash.  Court ordered the bond to remain as previously ordered.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, without an attorney.  Defendant thinks Attorney Gardner is going to  appear and represent him.  AIA set for 2/1/16 at 9:30 am.  Defendant to contact Attorney Gardner.  Bond continued.
